column2: The animation of the water in this movie is a character itself. It's absolutely stunning.
The reveal that Te Kā was actually Te Fiti without her heart was a mind-blowing and beautiful twist.
'You're Welcome' is the catchiest Disney song in years. Dwayne Johnson can do it all.
Moana restoring the heart by showing Te Kā compassion instead of fighting her... that's a powerful message.
Heihei the chicken is the dumbest and funniest character in any Disney movie. I love him.
Maui's hook getting destroyed and then restored by Te Fiti at the end was a great moment of redemption for him.
The relationship between Moana and her grandmother is so beautiful and heartwarming.
The final scene of Moana leading her people back out to sea as a wayfinder is the perfect ending.
The Kakamora are so cute and yet so terrifying. Those little coconut pirates are no joke.
The moment the ocean 'chooses' Moana as a baby is pure magic.
The music is incredible. Lin-Manuel Miranda is a genius.
Tamatoa the crab singing 'Shiny' is a fabulous villain song. So glam.
This movie is a beautiful celebration of Polynesian culture.
Moana realizing she has to be the one to restore the heart, even without Maui, is her true hero moment.
The designs of the boats and the island of Motunui are so detailed and beautiful.
The way Moana parts the sea to face Te Kā is an epic, biblical-level moment.
Pua the pig is adorable, but he really got sidelined for most of the movie. #JusticeForPua
The ending, with Motunui restored and the people returning to their voyaging roots, is so satisfying.
Moana is such a great role model. She's brave, smart, and follows her heart.
The spirit of her grandmother coming back as a manta ray to guide her was so beautiful.
The animation of the constellations and the wayfinding is breathtaking.
The twist isn't that there's a villain, but that the 'villain' is a corrupted hero who needs to be healed.
The dynamic between Moana and Maui is the heart of the film. They have great chemistry.
The final song, with the ancestors joining in, gives me goosebumps every time.
The movie is just a joy to watch. It's so full of life and adventure.
Maui getting his powers and his confidence back is a great character arc.
The lore of Te Fiti and the Heart is such a cool and original mythology.
The moment Moana walks on the water towards Te Kā is one of the most powerful shots in Disney history.
The humor is great, especially with Heihei and Maui's talking tattoos.
The ending is a beautiful message about healing and finding your true identity.
The voice acting is perfect, especially Auli'i Cravalho as Moana.
The way Moana uses her intelligence to outsmart Tamatoa is so clever.
The film is a stunning visual masterpiece.
The reveal that the monster was the goddess all along completely changes the story.
The songs are all bangers. I can't pick a favorite.
The final scene of her placing the shell on the mountain shows she's become a true leader.
The movie is a perfect adventure story with a lot of heart.
Maui's backstory about his parents abandoning him is surprisingly dark and adds so much depth to his character.
The film is a celebration of exploration and courage.
The moment Moana realizes she is the chosen one for a reason is a huge step in her journey.
The animation of the glowing ocean creatures is magical.
The twist with Te Kā is a beautiful lesson in looking past the anger to see the hurt.
The movie is just pure, unfiltered joy.
The final scene of the boats sailing out is so hopeful and inspiring.
The cultural consultants they worked with really made the world feel authentic.
Maui leaving and then coming back at the last minute to help was a classic hero move.
The film is a beautiful story about finding your place in the world.
The ending is a perfect culmination of Moana's journey from a chief's daughter to a master wayfinder.
The character designs are so expressive and appealing.
The way she uses the ocean's help to defeat the Kakamora is so smart.
A modern Disney classic that stands with the best of them.
The final song reprise of 'We Know the Way' brings the whole story full circle.
The animation is just breathtakingly beautiful.
The twist that Te Fiti is Te Kā is one of the best in any Disney film.
The songs are what make this movie truly special.
The ending is a powerful statement about empathy and understanding over violence.
The visuals are so rich and vibrant.
Maui's redemption arc is so well done.
The film is a perfect adventure for the whole family.
The way Moana restores the heart is an act of kindness, not a fight.
The score is just as incredible as the songs.
The ending is so emotionally satisfying.
The movie is a beautiful and inspiring story.
The reveal of Te Fiti's true form is a stunning visual moment.
The humor is perfectly blended with the more emotional moments.
The final scene is a perfect celebration of Moana's and her people's identity.
The world is so lush and beautifully realized.
Maui's character growth from a self-centered demigod to a true hero is great.
The film is a visual feast from start to finish.
The ending is a beautiful resolution that emphasizes healing over fighting.
The songs will be stuck in your head for days, and you won't even mind.
The way Moana connects with her ancestors through the boats in the cave is a powerful scene.
A perfect Disney movie with a great message and unforgettable music.
The final transformation of Te Kā back to Te Fiti is a beautiful and moving climax.
The animation of the lava and water clashing is incredible.
The moment Moana declares 'I am Moana!' is an all-time great Disney hero moment.
The film is a stunning work of art.
The ending, where she teaches her people to be wayfinders again, is a triumph.
The friendship between Moana and the ocean is so pure.
Maui's tattoos acting as his conscience is a hilarious and clever idea.
The movie is a beautiful journey of self-discovery.
The final scene is a perfect, hopeful ending for a wonderful story.
The culture and mythology are so rich and interesting.
The way Moana uses her wits to solve problems is what makes her such a great character.
The film is a modern masterpiece of animation.
The twist with Te Fiti is a beautiful metaphor for how pain can change us.
The music is the soul of the movie.
The ending is a perfect celebration of heritage and new beginnings.
The visuals are just on another plane of existence. So beautiful.
Maui's sacrifice of his hook for Moana shows how much he's changed.
A perfect film with a perfect message.
The final scene of her leading the fleet is a powerful image of a true leader.
The story is so well-paced and emotionally resonant.
The reveal that the ocean chose her for her compassion is a great touch.
The movie is a timeless classic.
The ending is a beautiful testament to the power of understanding and forgiveness.
